medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed suddenly the day before presentation, including nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fever, muscle aches, and a mild nonproductive cough. The patient reported that her symptoms were severe in the morning, preventing her from attending work. By the time of evaluation in the afternoon, she had experienced spontaneous improvement and felt well.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Exercise-induced asthma, gastroesophageal reflux disease, vitiligo, genital warts; prior negative screenings for hepatitis C virus and HIV; diagnosed with influenza 15 months before presentation; persistent bouts of fatigue and excessive sleepiness after influenza.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in an urban neighborhood in New England with her daughter, brother, and sister. Works two full-time jobs as a school counselor and bartender. Smokes one pack of cigarettes weekly for 17 years and drinks two to three alcoholic beverages weekly. History of substance use beginning in middle school, including intermittent use of marijuana, oral opioids, cocaine, and MDMA.
